description: From Middle English bitrappen, from Old English betræppan, betreppan (“to entrap, catch”), equivalent to be- +‎ trap. Cognate with Dutch betrappen (“to catch, surprise”).

verbs.description: betrap (third-person singular simple present betraps, present participle betrapping, simple past and past participle betrapped)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To catch in a trap; entrap; ensnare; enclose.

verbs.description: betrap (third-person singular simple present betraps, present participle betrapping, simple past and past participle betrapped)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To furnish (a horse) with trappings; deck; adorn.
